block.p: LEAD: INTERNATIONAL/-28 East Germany was ready to shoot protesters in Leipzig when Egon Krenz, then security chief, canceled Erich Honecker's order, party officials say. Page 1

Polish-Americans hail Walesa in Chicago rally 28
The price of halting global warming with limits on carbon-dioxide emissions will probably run to trillions of dollars through the next century, economists say. 1

Deng Xiaoping told Chinese officials that they should not listen to him if, as he gets older and becomes less clear-minded, he starts to say ''crazy things,'' according to a transcript of a speech he made in September. 3
Wall Street Journal ban erodes Thais' image for tolerance 14
Foe of Gandhi stung by accusations of C.I.A. role 8
Sri Lanka army claims a victory 17
The Ivory Coast is in a recession that is the worst since records were first kept, at the turn of the century. 16
Ex-South Africa officer says he led killings of opponents 15
Fighting continued in El Salvador as the Government used infantry and aircraft to rake rebel positions with intense machine-gun fire. 16
In farmlands of Nicaragua, words of war 10
Three British soldiers were killed and a fourth seriously wounded when their armored vehicle was blown up by a mine in Northern Ireland. 3

Case of seagoing corruption embarrasses Greece 13
Iran still violates human rights on the same large scale of torture and execution as it did under Ayatollah Khomeini, a U.N. investigator says. 19

Cyprus-Israel rift closes route to Soviet Jews 6
NATIONAL/30-39
The Air Force plans to close bases, phase out Minuteman 2 nuclear missiles and eliminate several fighter wings as a way to cut spending. 1
Civil War fields used as classrooms for defense analysts 37
Drug treatment is not working well enough to treat most addicts, experts say. But there is wide disagreement over how to improve the system. 1
Testing shows regional contrasts in criminals' cocaine use 34

Questions about use of fetal tissue in medical research are being raised not only by abortion foes but also by some physicians, who say they are uneasy over the way some groups obtain and distribute the tissue. 1
Pennsylvania abortion limits become law 38
Abortion rights bill introduced in the House 38
Security problems at urban schools come out in high relief at Jordan High School in Los Angeles, where the turf of at least six gangs intersect. 1
Congress neared adjournment, making agreements on sensitive issues like Congressional pay and extended health care for the elderly. 30

President's Thanksgiving Day proclamation
A robot spacecraft was launched to circle over the Earth's poles in a search for remnants in space of the start of the universe. 30
The National Council of Churches has installed a Polish-born Eastern Orthodox priest as its president. 30

REGIONAL/
A suspect in a drug agent's murder last February was found slumped in a car with numerous gunshot wounds on a Brooklyn street late Friday. 40
A search for a police commissioner for New York City is to begin this week with the naming of a search panel. 42

Funerals for two children killed during a tornado on Thursday were conducted in the small Hudson Valley villages of Walden and New Windsor. 40
